newsitem.title: UK: LME metals lower still in late PM, led by copper.
newsitem.headline: LME metals lower still in late PM, led by copper.

text.p: Base metal prices on the London Metal Exchange (LME) extended earlier losses in late evening inter-office trade, pushed lower by losses in the flagship copper contract.
Three month copper futures ere indicated at $1,880/85 a tonne by 1820 GMT, below the psychological $1,900 support level and well down on Wednesday's afternoon kerb close of $1,915.
Traders said fund and trade selling in New York helped drag LME prices lower. Bearish sentiment could see the market as low as $1,800 soon, some dealers said.
Zinc was approaching the psychological $1,000 barrier. It was last quoted at $1,000/05 from $1,009 at the afternoon close.
A break below support at $997 would see the market at its lowest level for nearly eleven months.
Aluminium was also little changed from an earlier two-year low of $1,437 at $1,435/40.
Nickel and tin were showing small falls from the kerb close. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 8057
